```{r}
library(data.table)
library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
```

```{r}
df <- fread("/Users/chrissoria/Documents/Research/BICS_Political_Polarization/data/BICS_ZIP_Features.csv")
RD_df <- df[df$political_party %in% c("Republican", "Democrat"), ]
```


The closer to republicanisn
```{r}
dvr_contact_reduction_model <- glm(contact_reduction ~  COV_County_CMR_2020_06_20 + State_Government_Response_Index_11192020 + COUNTY_RUCC_2013 + resp_sex + resp_educ + resp_yob + r_working + r_race + political_party_to_CD, data = df, family = binomial)

# View the model summary
summary(dvr_contact_reduction_model)
rm(dvr_contact_reduction_model)
```
Being in an opposing party CD means less likely to be concerened about the spread of the virus
```{r}
dvr_concern_model <- glm(binary_concern_strong ~  COV_County_CMR_2020_06_20 + State_Government_Response_Index_11192020 + COUNTY_RUCC_2013 + resp_sex + resp_educ + resp_yob + r_working + r_race + political_party_to_CD, data = df, family = binomial)

# View the model summary
summary(dvr_concern_model)
rm(dvr_concern_model)
```
However, being in an opposing CD doesn't mean you're less likely to report contact
```{r}
opp_contact_model <- lm(Contacts ~  COV_County_CMR_2020_06_20 + State_Government_Response_Index_11192020 + COUNTY_RUCC_2013 + resp_sex + resp_educ + resp_yob + r_working + r_race + political_party_to_CD, data = df)

# View the model summary
summary(opp_contact_model)
rm(opp_contact_model)
```
being in an opposing cd means you're less likely to wear masks
```{r}
opp_masked_contact_model <- lm(Norm_Masks_Used ~  COV_County_CMR_2020_06_20 + State_Government_Response_Index_11192020 + COUNTY_RUCC_2013 + resp_sex + resp_educ + resp_yob + r_working + r_race + political_party_to_CD, data = df)

# View the model summary
summary(opp_masked_contact_model)
rm(opp_masked_contact_model)
```
Overall, they're less likely to be safe in their contacts
```{r}
opp_safety_model <- lm(Non_Weighted_Safety_Index ~  COV_County_CMR_2020_06_20 + State_Government_Response_Index_11192020 + COUNTY_RUCC_2013 + resp_sex + resp_educ + resp_yob + r_working + r_race + political_party_to_CD, data = df)

# View the model summary
summary(opp_safety_model)
rm(opp_safety_model)
```
